channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-4847] Activate single jvm for small tests on jenkins
item.description:
This will not revolutionate performances alone. We will win between 1 to 4 minutes.

But we win as well:

  • it's a step for parallelizing the tests
  • new tests are less expensive as they do not create a new jvm: it's a continuous win
  • it will allow to push it on dev env while having the same env on dev & on build, and 3 minutes are 10% of small + medium tests execution time.

I will do a few "submit patch" to see if it works well before asking for the real commit.
item.summary: Activate single jvm for small tests on jenkins

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12504745/4847_pom.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 javac. The patch appears to cause mvn compile goal to fail.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to cause Findbugs (version 1.3.9) to fail.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

This message is automatically generated.
It seems odd that this patch would cause the above failure. Is that your sense N?

Well, as with this patch all small tests are executed in a shared jvm, we can see some side effects. However, I ran these test more than 20 times, and it's working in my env. I deactivated parallelism to avoid random results. So it's strange.

I went to the debugger for TestMinVersions#testBaseCase, and it seems the only to get this results is using a wrong EnvironmentEdgeManager. But I checked that only the default is used for small tests. The patch v7 add a check & a reset for the EnvironmentEdgeManager, I will see what are the results...

"java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: unable to create new native thread" twice in a row.

let's wait.

We're leaking threads in the tests actually. It seems that hadoop-qa is less tolerant than my env; but the issue is real.

Here is a snapshot.

main.logSyncer

main.logSyncer

main.logSyncer

Signal Dispatcher

main.logSyncer

main.logSyncer

Finalizer

main.logSyncer

main.logSyncer

mockserver.example.org,1234,-1.splitLogManagerTimeoutMonitor

main

mockserver.example.org,1234,-1.splitLogManagerTimeoutMonitor

main.logSyncer

main.logSyncer

main.logSyncer

main.logSyncer

main.logSyncer

main.logSyncer

main.logSyncer

main.logSyncer leaks when you don't close the hlog linked to a region. Many tests closes the region but not the hlog, while some other closes nothing. The patch v12 fixes some leaks, not all of them.

I will try anyway to limit it it to something not too large if not it won't be possible to keep in sync with trunk...

This message is automatically generated.

I think it's ok for commit.
Time to execute 917 tests (small+medium) was 35 minutes (announced 18 minutes, but this does not take into account the set up time), so we're executing 75% of the tests in 25% of the time.

It's necessary to change Jenkins config to run all tests (i.e: large as well), and make it use the profile "runAllTests".

Patch looks good. Some tests fail intermittently but doesn't seem to be fault of this patch. Committing.

Have we broken the running of a single test or if not, what is the arg needed now?

When I do:


$ mvn clean test -Dtest=TestAssignmentManager

I get:


-------------------------------------------------------

 T E S T S

-------------------------------------------------------

Running org.junit.runner.manipulation.Filter

Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.003 sec <<< FAILURE!



Results :



Tests in error: 

  initializationError(org.junit.runner.manipulation.Filter): No tests found matching (category interface org.apache.hadoop.hbase.SmallTests) from org.junit.runner.Request$1@4ac4aad3



Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0



[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[ERROR] BUILD FAILURE

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] There are test failures.

I committed to trunk and altered the trunk build to add '-PrunAllTests'. Other trunk builds such as the security build are already using a profile – i.e. the -Psecurity profile – so I can't add the run all tests profile to these it seems. Thats probably not too bad since we're going to refactor trunk so things like security are done as maven submodules rather than as maven profiles so this circumstance is transitory.

You have this error because

  • the default is to run small categories, and TestAssignmentManager is not small => there is nothing to test
  • may be TestAssignmentManager has not category, so you can meet surefire-789 (a bug that I didn't put in the lists as we're supposed to have a category for all tests).

The parameter to use to launch a specific test is -P localTests: this removes all the category stuff.

The running of individual tests and the other permutations listed here are broke: http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#maven.build.commands.unit Should I back this out N? You think you can fix this in another issue? Thanks.

I don't see TestAssignmentManager under TRUNK.
I was able to run TestMemStore individually.

@stack

It's documented in hbase-4712


1.3) mvn test -P localTests -Dtest=myTests



remove any category effect (without this specific profile, the profiles are taken into account)

use actually the official release of surefire & the old connector to junit

tests are executed in separated JVM

you will see a new message at the end of the report: "[INFO] Tests are skipped". It's harmless.

13.4.2 can be replaced by hbase-4712
